title: Stocks Fall Sharply Ahead Of "Big Tuesday" Primaries
description:
As financial markets reckon with another acute shock, a question for the White House resurfaces: will it take measures to stabilize the U.S. economy? And Michigan, Missouri, and four other states head to the polls Tuesday, in what could be be a make-or-break day for Bernie Sanders' presidential campaign.

This episode: White House correspondent Tamara Keith, chief economics correspondent Scott Horsley, campaign correspondent Juana Summers, and national political correspondent Don Gonyea.

itunes:title: Stocks Fall Sharply Ahead Of "Big Tuesday" Primaries
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: In this episode, NPR reporters discuss the stock slide that halted trading Monday and what is at stake in Tuesday's six primary contests, including Michigan.
itunes:subtitle: In this episode, NPR reporters discuss the stock slide that halted trading Monday and what is at stake in Tuesday's six primary contests, including Michigan.
